bibl.title: Letter from C.C. Bass to Henry Rose Carter, March 10, 1919

div1.p: Bass invites Carter to take part in a symposium on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from C.C. Bass to Henry Rose Carter, March 10, 1919
div1.opener:
LABORATORY OF CLINICAL MEDICINE
Y. Fever:' Bass
Answered
Provisionally
Accepting
March 16/19
The College of Medicine
School of Medicine
Tulane University of Louisiana
P. O. BOX 770
NEW ORLEANS, LA., March 10, 1919
Dr. H. R. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I am trying to get up a symposium on yellow fever as a
prominent part of the program of the next meeting of the American
Society of Tropical Medicine to be held in Atlantic City on June
16. Noguchi has promised to present his recent discoveries in the
cultivation of the specific organism and I want to know if you will
not take part in the program. Present a paper on whatever feature of
the subject you will choose.

Your early pioneer work and observations on the transmission
of yellow fever especially would make an American symposium on the sub-
ject incomplete without your name. Please give the invitation serious
consideration and don't turn it down.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, C C Bass
President, American Society
of Tropical Medicine.
